required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: We will evaluate a transdiagnostic digital emotion regulation treatment for youth with mental health problems.

detailed_description.textblock: Mental health problems in youth are a global problem, causing incalculable suffering in youth and families, harming long-term prospects of youths, and are creating substantial economic costs to society. Existing treatments are not fully addressing these problems because they focus on a subset of mental health problems; they are limited in efficacy; and are not provided to most youth in need. Transdiagnostic digital treatments that address mechanisms underlying mental health problems, such as emotion regulation, have been called for to address these problems. As an initial pilot study we will include 60 participants aged 12-17 years and their parents in a randomized controlled feasibility trial comparing a 6-week Primary care Online Emotion-regulation Treatment (POET) to a 6-week active Supportive Treatment (ST). Both interventions will be delivered in blended format combining online therapist-supported treatment modules with a video-link session. The primary study aims are to examine the feasibility and acceptability of study protocol and treatment protocols. Preliminary utility of the experimental condition will be evaluated by youth-reported, parent-reported, and clinical-reported outcomes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment 6 weeks after baseline
primary_outcome.description: Completion of follow-up will be defined as completing at least one clinical outcome at end of intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: The fraction of eligible participants who consent to inclusion and randomization
primary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment 6 weeks after baseline
primary_outcome.description: We will determine the fraction of potential participants as the number of eligible persons compared to the number of randomized persons.

primary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment 6 weeks after baseline
primary_outcome.description: Compliance with the experimental intervention will be defined as completing at least three of six modules/sessions.

primary_outcome.measure: Child version or the Cognitive Emotion Regulation Questionnaire as explorative primary clinical outcome
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline, once every week during treatment (0-6 weeks after baseline)

primary_outcome.measure: Revised Child Anxiety and Depression Scale as explorative primary clinical outcome
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline, once every week during treatment (0-6 weeks after baseline)
primary_outcome.description: Measure of anxiety and depression symptoms

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline, 6 weeks after treatment starts
Change from baseline, 6 weeks after treatment starts
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of youth strengths and difficulties

secondary_outcome.measure: Brief 16-item Version of the Difficulties In Emotion Regulation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline, 6 weeks after treatment starts
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of difficulties in emotion regulation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline, 6 weeks after treatment starts
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of difficulties in cognitive reappraisal and suppression

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline, 6 weeks after treatment starts
Change from baseline, 6 weeks after treatment starts

arm_group.description: The youth component in the experimental condition will include psychoeducation, addressing maladaptive beliefs about emotions and emotion regulation, and teaching adaptive emotion regulation strategies, such as mindfulness practice and acceptance of emotions and flexible cognitive reappraisal. The parent component will include psychoeducation and teaching effective responding to their children's and their own emotions.

The intervention will be delivered in a blended treatment format combining asynchronous therapist-guided online modules (text/videos/audio/messaging function) with a synchronous session delivered over video-link.

intervention.intervention_name: Therapist-supported digitally delivered transdiagnostic emotion regulation treatment
intervention.description: Please see description of experimental arm (arm one)
Please see description of active comparator arm (arm two)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Presenting with mental health problems
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute suicidality and severe mental illness that require specialized care
